required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Effect of Juice Types on the Responses to Air Pollution
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Oral Nitrate Supplementation on Vascular and Pulmonary Oxidative Stress Markers Following Traffic Pollution Exposure

lead_sponsor.agency: Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey

clinical_study.source: Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey

brief_summary.textblock: The study hypothesis is that drinking different juices will affect the body's responses to air pollution. Subjects will be exposed to air pollution during a 2-hour car ride on the NJ (New Jersey) Turnpike. Each subject will be asked to do this twice. Before one car ride, the subject will be asked to drink orange juice. Before the other car ride, the subject will be asked to drink beet juice. Samples of blood and exhaled breath will be collected before, immediately after, and 24 hours after each car ride. Levels of nitrites/nitrates will be measured in the blood and breath.

detailed_description.textblock:
Subjects will participate in two exposure sessions. The air pollution exposure consists of a 2-hour car ride along the NJ Turnpike. Samples will be collected at 3 time points for each exposure session: pre-exposure, immediately post-exposure, and 24 hours post-exposure. Blood samples will be collected immediately before and after a 5-minute occlusion at each time point. The subject will also be asked to provide samples of exhaled breath and complete symptom and stress questionnaires at each time point.
Blood samples will be analyzed for serum nitrite. Exhaled breath samples will be analyzed for nitrates and nitrites.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Prior to the car ride, immediately after the 2-hour car ride, and 24 hours later
primary_outcome.description: Change in plasma nitrite concentration pre- and post-occlusion

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in nitrite/nitrate concentration in exhaled breath
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Prior to the car ride, immediately after the 2 hour car ride and 24 hours later
secondary_outcome.description: Change in nitrite/nitrate concentration in exhaled breath

arm_group.description: Beet juice will be given prior to the first car ride and orange juice will be given prior to the second car ride.
Orange juice will be given before the first car ride and beet juice will be given before the second car ride.

intervention.description: 2 cups of beet juice will be given before the car ride
2 cups of orange juice will be given before the car ride

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy
- Must live within 20 miles of Piscataway, NJ
Exclusion Criteria:
- â€¢ Are a current smoker
- Are pregnant or breastfeeding
- Are HIV-positive
- Have an active medical condition such as high blood pressure, asthma, diabetes or other serious disease
- Have a heart condition such as atrial flutter, atrial fibrillation or a pacemaker
- Are unable to ride comfortably in a car for 2 hours
- Travel to the EOHSI (Environmental and Occupational Health Sciences Institute) Clinic Center on major highways for more than 3 miles (the Garden State Parkway, the New Jersey Turnpike, Routes 287, 1, 18, or 9).

facility.name: Environmental and Occupational Health Sciences Institute

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey
